article.headline: Charlotte 82, Houston 61
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Demon Brown scored eight 3-pointers, including six in the second half, and finished with 26 points to lead Charlotte to an 82-61 win over Houston on Wednesday night. Charlotte (19-7, 11-4 Conference USA) led 48-40 with 13 minutes left before Brown made four 3-pointers in less than 2{ minutes to extend its lead to 60-43. Brown hit another 3-pointer with 3:55 left to put Charlotte ahead 75-57 and his last basket of the night came when he sunk another 3-pointer with seven seconds left. Houston (9-17, 3-12) led 8-2 early in the game, but Charlotte was ahead 35-34 at halftime. Houston made just 7-of-25 field goals in the second half for 28 percent. Charlotte was 70 percent from the 3-point line in the second half and also made 14 free throws. Eddie Basden had 16 points for Charlotte and Butter Johnson scored 15. Andre Owens scored 25 points for Houston and Marcus Oliver added 15.
